department.ch: 化學工程與材料工程學系

goal.ch:
The major goal of this course is to cover practical mathematical methods important to
engineering applications. It is expected that students already have a mathematical
background, including undergraduate courses in calculus and linear algebra. In
general, this course will be focused on more advanced topics, including linear
differential equations (initial and boundary value problems), the Laplace transform,
and vector analysis. An important goal of this course is to learn how to use analytical
methods in concert with computer calculations. Computational parts of the course
include the use of the MATLAB package.
goal.en:
The major goal of this course is to cover practical mathematical methods important to
engineering applications. It is expected that students already have a mathematical
background, including undergraduate courses in calculus and linear algebra. In
general, this course will be focused on more advanced topics, including linear
differential equations (initial and boundary value problems), the Laplace transform,
and vector analysis. An important goal of this course is to learn how to use analytical
methods in concert with computer calculations. Computational parts of the course
include the use of the MATLAB package.

outline.ch:
Part A Ordinary differential equations
Chap. 1 1 st -Order ODEs
Chap. 2 2 nd -Order Linear ODEs
Series solutions
* Chap. 19 Complex Numbers and Functions
Chap. 3 Laplace Transform
Chap. 4 Sturm-Liouville Problems and Eigenfunction Expansion
Part B Vector Analysis
Chap. 15 Vector Differential Calculus
Chap. 16 Vector Integral Calculus
outline.en:
Part A Ordinary differential equations
Chap. 1 1 st -Order ODEs
Chap. 2 2 nd -Order Linear ODEs
Series solutions
* Chap. 19 Complex Numbers and Functions
Chap. 3 Laplace Transform
Chap. 4 Sturm-Liouville Problems and Eigenfunction Expansion
Part B Vector Analysis
Chap. 15 Vector Differential Calculus
Chap. 16 Vector Integral Calculus

textbook.ch:
1.Advanced Engineering Mathematics (8 th Ed.), P. V. O’Neil
2. Advanced Engineering Mathematics (7 th Ed.), D. G. Zill
3. Portal/Learning Management System

gradMethod.ch:
3 Exams (12 Oct., 23 Nov., 28 Dec.) 3 × 24% = 72%
3 Recitation (2 Oct., 13 Nov., 18 Dec.) 3 × 4% = 12%
12 Quiz (20 min. at Thurs.) 12× 2% = 24%
Extra Points (Q&A, report, …) (max.) 7%

flexDiscription.ch: Read more about engineering cases. Check the use of the MATLAB from the Internet for engineering applications. (Online learning and self-directed learning)
flexDiscription.en: Read more about engineering cases. Check the use of the MATLAB from the Internet for engineering applications. (Online learning and self-directed learning)
